newsitem.title: BELGIUM: EU CONFIRMS CLEARS ADM/ACATOS BUY OF SOYA MAINZ.
newsitem.headline: EU CONFIRMS CLEARS ADM/ACATOS BUY OF SOYA MAINZ.

text.p: The European Commission said on Wednesday it had cleared the acquisition by a German subsidiary of ADM International Ltd and Acatos & Hutcheson Plc of German soybeans processor Soya Mainz GmbH.

It said in a statement that although the companies involved are big players in the affected markets -- oil meals, edible oils and Lecithins -- the transaction would not result in the creation of a dominant position in the European Union.

It particularly noted that worldwide Lecithin supply exceeds demand and that the companies had guaranteed they would continue the existing supply arrangements with independent wholesaler Lukas Meyer. Lecithin is a product sold in health food shops to reduce cholesterol absorption.
"Although the parties are highly vertically integrated and these markets are highly concentrated, the joint venture does not lead to a dominant position," the statement said.
A Commission source had told Reuters on Tuesday that the deal had been cleared.

Soya Mainz said in June it had been sold to Archer-Daniels-Midland's ADM Beteiligungsgesellschaft mbH and Acatos, a British company active in the bottling and canning of vegetable oils. It was previously owned by the Wilh. Werhahn group and Heidelberger Zement AG.
The sale was filed for EU regulatory approval on July 8.
ADM already has a controlling stake in leading German processor Oelmuehle Hamburg AG, which in 1996 crushed 3.10 million tonnes of soybeans. -- Amelia Torres 322 2876841
